alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Central Laramie County; East Laramie County; East Platte County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Goshen County; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued February 18 at 1:51AM MST until February 21 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph possible. * WHERE...Ferris/Seminoe/Shirley Mountains, East Platte County, Goshen County, Central Carbon County, South Laramie Range Foothills, Central Laramie County and East Laramie County. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Central Laramie County; East Laramie County; East Platte County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Goshen County; South Laramie Range Foothills
